info.title: Recommend API
info.description: API powering the Recommend feature of Algolia.

get.summary: Send requests to the Algolia REST API.
get.description: This method allow you to send requests to the Algolia REST API.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the API endpoint to target, anything after the /1 needs to be specified.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Query parameters to be applied to the current query.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

requestBody.description: The parameters to send with the custom request.

post.summary: Send requests to the Algolia REST API.
post.description: This method allow you to send requests to the Algolia REST API.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the API endpoint to target, anything after the /1 needs to be specified.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Query parameters to be applied to the current query.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

requestBody.description: The parameters to send with the custom request.

put.summary: Send requests to the Algolia REST API.
put.description: This method allow you to send requests to the Algolia REST API.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the API endpoint to target, anything after the /1 needs to be specified.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Query parameters to be applied to the current query.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

delete.summary: Send requests to the Algolia REST API.
delete.description: This method allow you to send requests to the Algolia REST API.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the API endpoint to target, anything after the /1 needs to be specified.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Query parameters to be applied to the current query.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

post.description: Returns recommendations or trending results, for a specific model and `objectID`.

facetName.description: The facet name to use for trending models.

facetValue.description: The facet value to use for trending models.

threshold.description: The threshold to use when filtering recommendations by their score.

maxRecommendations.description: The max number of recommendations to retrieve. If it's set to 0, all the recommendations of the objectID may be returned.

query.description: The text to search in the index.

similarQuery.description: Overrides the query parameter and performs a more generic search that can be used to find "similar" results.

filters.description: Filter the query with numeric, facet and/or tag filters.

optionalFilters.description: Create filters for ranking purposes, where records that match the filter are ranked higher, or lower in the case of a negative optional filter.

sumOrFiltersScores.description: Determines how to calculate the total score for filtering.

facets.description: Retrieve facets and their facet values.

maxValuesPerFacet.description: Maximum number of facet values to return for each facet during a regular search.

facetingAfterDistinct.description: Force faceting to be applied after de-duplication (via the Distinct setting).

sortFacetValuesBy.description: Controls how facet values are fetched.

offset.description: Specify the offset of the first hit to return.

length.description: Set the number of hits to retrieve (used only with offset).

aroundLatLng.description: Search for entries around a central geolocation, enabling a geo search within a circular area.

aroundLatLngViaIP.description: Search for entries around a given location automatically computed from the requester's IP address.

aroundRadius.description: Define the maximum radius for a geo search (in meters).

aroundPrecision.description: Precision of geo search (in meters), to add grouping by geo location to the ranking formula.

minimumAroundRadius.description: Minimum radius (in meters) used for a geo search when aroundRadius is not set.

insideBoundingBox.description: Search inside a rectangular area (in geo coordinates).

insidePolygon.description: Search inside a polygon (in geo coordinates).

naturalLanguages.description: This parameter changes the default values of certain parameters and settings that work best for a natural language query, such as ignorePlurals, removeStopWords, removeWordsIfNoResults, analyticsTags and ruleContexts. These parameters and settings work well together when the query is formatted in natural language instead of keywords, for example when your user performs a voice search.

personalizationImpact.description: Define the impact of the Personalization feature.

userToken.description: Associates a certain user token with the current search.

analytics.description: Whether the current query will be taken into account in the Analytics.

analyticsTags.description: List of tags to apply to the query for analytics purposes.

percentileComputation.description: Whether to include or exclude a query from the processing-time percentile computation.

enableABTest.description: Whether this search should participate in running AB tests.

enableReRanking.description: Whether this search should use AI Re-Ranking.

reRankingApplyFilter.description: When Dynamic Re-Ranking is enabled, only records that match these filters will be impacted by Dynamic Re-Ranking.

attributesForFaceting.description: The complete list of attributes that will be used for faceting.

attributesToRetrieve.description: This parameter controls which attributes to retrieve and which not to retrieve.

restrictSearchableAttributes.description: Restricts a given query to look in only a subset of your searchable attributes.

ranking.description: Controls how Algolia should sort your results.

relevancyStrictness.description: Controls the relevancy threshold below which less relevant results aren't included in the results.

attributesToSnippet.description: List of attributes to snippet, with an optional maximum number of words to snippet.

highlightPreTag.description: The HTML string to insert before the highlighted parts in all highlight and snippet results.

highlightPostTag.description: The HTML string to insert after the highlighted parts in all highlight and snippet results.

snippetEllipsisText.description: String used as an ellipsis indicator when a snippet is truncated.

restrictHighlightAndSnippetArrays.description: Restrict highlighting and snippeting to items that matched the query.

hitsPerPage.description: Set the number of hits per page.

minWordSizefor1Typo.description: Minimum number of characters a word in the query string must contain to accept matches with 1 typo.

minWordSizefor2Typos.description: Minimum number of characters a word in the query string must contain to accept matches with 2 typos.

typoTolerance.description: Controls whether typo tolerance is enabled and how it is applied.

allowTyposOnNumericTokens.description: Whether to allow typos on numbers ("numeric tokens") in the query string.

disableTypoToleranceOnAttributes.description: List of attributes on which you want to disable typo tolerance.

ignorePlurals.description:
Treats singular, plurals, and other forms of declensions as matching terms.
ignorePlurals is used in conjunction with the queryLanguages setting.
list: language ISO codes for which ignoring plurals should be enabled. This list will override any values that you may have set in queryLanguages. true: enables the ignore plurals functionality, where singulars and plurals are considered equivalent (foot = feet). The languages supported here are either every language (this is the default, see list of languages below), or those set by queryLanguages. false: disables ignore plurals, where singulars and plurals are not considered the same for matching purposes (foot will not find feet).

removeStopWords.description:
Removes stop (common) words from the query before executing it.
removeStopWords is used in conjunction with the queryLanguages setting.
list: language ISO codes for which ignoring plurals should be enabled. This list will override any values that you may have set in queryLanguages. true: enables the stop word functionality, ensuring that stop words are removed from consideration in a search. The languages supported here are either every language, or those set by queryLanguages. false: disables stop word functionality, allowing stop words to be taken into account in a search.

keepDiacriticsOnCharacters.description: List of characters that the engine shouldn't automatically normalize.

queryLanguages.description: Sets the languages to be used by language-specific settings and functionalities such as ignorePlurals, removeStopWords, and CJK word-detection.

decompoundQuery.description: Splits compound words into their composing atoms in the query.

enableRules.description: Whether Rules should be globally enabled.

queryType.description: Controls if and how query words are interpreted as prefixes.

removeWordsIfNoResults.description: Selects a strategy to remove words from the query when it doesn't match any hits.

mode.description: The search mode that the index will use to query for results.

semanticSearch.description: The settings relevant for configuration of the semantic search engine. These settings are only used when the mode is set to 'neuralSearch'.

eventSources.description: When null, the current index / replica group will be used as the event source.

optionalWords.description: A list of words that should be considered as optional when found in the query.

disableExactOnAttributes.description: List of attributes on which you want to disable the exact ranking criterion.

exactOnSingleWordQuery.description: Controls how the exact ranking criterion is computed when the query contains only one word.

alternativesAsExact.description: List of alternatives that should be considered an exact match by the exact ranking criterion.

advancedSyntaxFeatures.description: Allows you to specify which advanced syntax features are active when ‘advancedSyntax' is enabled.

explain.description: Enriches the API’s response with meta-information as to how the query was processed.

distinct.description: Enables de-duplication or grouping of results.

attributeForDistinct.description: Name of the de-duplication attribute to be used with the distinct feature.

synonyms.description: Whether to take into account an index's synonyms for a particular search.

replaceSynonymsInHighlight.description: Whether to highlight and snippet the original word that matches the synonym or the synonym itself.

minProximity.description: Precision of the proximity ranking criterion.

responseFields.description: Choose which fields to return in the API response. This parameters applies to search and browse queries.

maxFacetHits.description: Maximum number of facet hits to return during a search for facet values. For performance reasons, the maximum allowed number of returned values is 100.

attributeCriteriaComputedByMinProximity.description: When attribute is ranked above proximity in your ranking formula, proximity is used to select which searchable attribute is matched in the attribute ranking stage.

renderingContent.description: Content defining how the search interface should be rendered. Can be set via the settings for a default value and can be overridden via rules.

facetOrdering.description: Defining how facets should be ordered.

values.description: The ordering of facet values, within an individual list.

sortRemainingBy.description:
How to display the remaining items.
  - `count`: facet count (descending).
  - `alpha`: alphabetical (ascending).
  - `hidden`: show only pinned values.

list: language ISO codes for which ignoring plurals should be enabled. This list will override any values that you may have set in queryLanguages. true: enables the ignore plurals functionality, where singulars and plurals are considered equivalent (foot = feet). The languages supported here are either every language (this is the default, see list of languages below), or those set by queryLanguages. false: disables ignore plurals, where singulars and plurals are not considered the same for matching purposes (foot will not find feet).

removeStopWords.description:
Removes stop (common) words from the query before executing it.
removeStopWords is used in conjunction with the queryLanguages setting.
list: language ISO codes for which ignoring plurals should be enabled. This list will override any values that you may have set in queryLanguages. true: enables the stop word functionality, ensuring that stop words are removed from consideration in a search. The languages supported here are either every language, or those set by queryLanguages. false: disables stop word functionality, allowing stop words to be taken into account in a search.

keepDiacriticsOnCharacters.description: List of characters that the engine shouldn't automatically normalize.

queryLanguages.description: Sets the languages to be used by language-specific settings and functionalities such as ignorePlurals, removeStopWords, and CJK word-detection.

decompoundQuery.description: Splits compound words into their composing atoms in the query.

enableRules.description: Whether Rules should be globally enabled.

queryType.description: Controls if and how query words are interpreted as prefixes.

removeWordsIfNoResults.description: Selects a strategy to remove words from the query when it doesn't match any hits.

mode.description: The search mode that the index will use to query for results.

semanticSearch.description: The settings relevant for configuration of the semantic search engine. These settings are only used when the mode is set to 'neuralSearch'.

eventSources.description: When null, the current index / replica group will be used as the event source.

optionalWords.description: A list of words that should be considered as optional when found in the query.

disableExactOnAttributes.description: List of attributes on which you want to disable the exact ranking criterion.

exactOnSingleWordQuery.description: Controls how the exact ranking criterion is computed when the query contains only one word.

alternativesAsExact.description: List of alternatives that should be considered an exact match by the exact ranking criterion.

advancedSyntaxFeatures.description: Allows you to specify which advanced syntax features are active when ‘advancedSyntax' is enabled.

explain.description: Enriches the API’s response with meta-information as to how the query was processed.

distinct.description: Enables de-duplication or grouping of results.

attributeForDistinct.description: Name of the de-duplication attribute to be used with the distinct feature.

synonyms.description: Whether to take into account an index's synonyms for a particular search.

replaceSynonymsInHighlight.description: Whether to highlight and snippet the original word that matches the synonym or the synonym itself.

minProximity.description: Precision of the proximity ranking criterion.

responseFields.description: Choose which fields to return in the API response. This parameters applies to search and browse queries.

maxFacetHits.description: Maximum number of facet hits to return during a search for facet values. For performance reasons, the maximum allowed number of returned values is 100.

attributeCriteriaComputedByMinProximity.description: When attribute is ranked above proximity in your ranking formula, proximity is used to select which searchable attribute is matched in the attribute ranking stage.

renderingContent.description: Content defining how the search interface should be rendered. Can be set via the settings for a default value and can be overridden via rules.

facetOrdering.description: Defining how facets should be ordered.

values.description: The ordering of facet values, within an individual list.

sortRemainingBy.description:
How to display the remaining items.
  - `count`: facet count (descending).
  - `alpha`: alphabetical (ascending).
  - `hidden`: show only pinned values.

abTestID.description: If a search encounters an index that is being A/B tested, abTestID reports the ongoing A/B test ID.

abTestVariantID.description: If a search encounters an index that is being A/B tested, abTestVariantID reports the variant ID of the index used (starting at 1).

automaticRadius.description: The automatically computed radius. For legacy reasons, this parameter is a string and not an integer.

exhaustiveFacetsCount.description: Whether the facet count is exhaustive or approximate.

exhaustiveNbHits.description: Indicate if the nbHits count was exhaustive or approximate.

exhaustiveTypo.description: Indicate if the typo-tolerance search was exhaustive or approximate (only included when typo-tolerance is enabled).

facets.title: facets
facets.description: A mapping of each facet name to the corresponding facet counts.

min.description: The minimum value in the result set.

max.description: The maximum value in the result set.

avg.description: The average facet value in the result set.

sum.description: The sum of all values in the result set.

hitsPerPage.description: Set the number of hits per page.

index.description: Index name used for the query.

indexUsed.description: Index name used for the query. In the case of an A/B test, the targeted index isn't always the index used by the query.

message.description: Used to return warnings about the query.

nbHits.description: Number of hits that the search query matched.

nbPages.description: Number of pages available for the current query.

nbSortedHits.description: The number of hits selected and sorted by the relevant sort algorithm.

params.description: A url-encoded string of all search parameters.

redirect.description: This parameter is for internal use only.

source.description: Source index for the redirect rule.

dest.description: Destination index for the redirect rule.

parsedQuery.description: The query string that will be searched, after normalization.

processingTimeMS.description: Time the server took to process the request, in milliseconds.

query.description: The text to search in the index.

queryAfterRemoval.description: A markup text indicating which parts of the original query have been removed in order to retrieve a non-empty result set.

serverUsed.description: Actual host name of the server that processed the request.

userData.description: Lets you store custom data in your indices.

renderingContent.description: Content defining how the search interface should be rendered. Can be set via the settings for a default value and can be overridden via rules.

facetOrdering.description: Defining how facets should be ordered.

values.description: The ordering of facet values, within an individual list.

sortRemainingBy.description:
How to display the remaining items.
  - `count`: facet count (descending).
  - `alpha`: alphabetical (ascending).
  - `hidden`: show only pinned values.

_highlightResult.description: Show highlighted section and words matched on a query.

oneOf.description: Show highlighted section and words matched on a query.

matchLevel.description: Indicates how well the attribute matched the search query.

matchedWords.description: List of words from the query that matched the object.

fullyHighlighted.description: Whether the entire attribute value is highlighted.

items.description: Show highlighted section and words matched on a query.

matchLevel.description: Indicates how well the attribute matched the search query.

matchedWords.description: List of words from the query that matched the object.

fullyHighlighted.description: Whether the entire attribute value is highlighted.

_snippetResult.description: Snippeted attributes show parts of the matched attributes. Only returned when attributesToSnippet is non-empty.

oneOf.description: Snippeted attributes show parts of the matched attributes. Only returned when attributesToSnippet is non-empty.

matchLevel.description: Indicates how well the attribute matched the search query.

items.description: Snippeted attributes show parts of the matched attributes. Only returned when attributesToSnippet is non-empty.

matchLevel.description: Indicates how well the attribute matched the search query.

filters.description: This field is reserved for advanced usage.

firstMatchedWord.description: Position of the most important matched attribute in the attributes to index list.

geoDistance.description: Distance between the geo location in the search query and the best matching geo location in the record, divided by the geo precision (in meters).

geoPrecision.description: Precision used when computing the geo distance, in meters.

distance.description: Distance between the matched location and the search location (in meters).

nbTypos.description: Number of typos encountered when matching the record.

promoted.description: Present and set to true if a Rule promoted the hit.

proximityDistance.description: When the query contains more than one word, the sum of the distances between matched words (in meters).

userScore.description: Custom ranking for the object, expressed as a single integer value.

words.description: Number of matched words, including prefixes and typos.

promotedByReRanking.description: Wether the record are promoted by the re-ranking strategy.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.
